comments.commentBody:
There are only three significant options that will get us out of this fiscal mess.

1) Raise taxes.
2) Raise taxes.
3) Raise taxes.

We need to return the tax code to the Eisenhower era when the rich actually paid their fair share. We need to close all the corporate loopholes so that US companies actually pay taxes. We need to implement an industrial policy that will actually start to create manufacturing jobs.

Until the American people stop eating jelly donuts and watching whatever sports entertainment is on their TVs and actually take to the streets to demand better, this circus will continue unabated.

Frankly I see no end in sight.

Do you?

Let's cut all the drama..The government "shutting down" is only defunding 25% of it, and it is a fact that the government has 25% waste. Defund EPA, the Board of Education, etc. There is so much redundency in our government that it is criminal. The federal government was not designed with its massive size as it is. Let DC see what the rest of the country has been experiencing for years now and maybe they will get real about STOPPING THE SPENDING! You Democrats just like to keep the pot stirred...It's time for this country to come together or perish...

Military employees would not receive a paycheck until a budget is approved, though of course, they and their families continue to serve this country fulfilling their code of honor unlike the morally bankrupt legislators holding this country hostage.
Unconscionable !

Ah, the joys of ideology divorced from governance considerations and even reality!

We're bombing a civil war in a small country, forcing "democracy" on a second, pulling out from an illegitimate invasion of a third, being assaulted in a nuclear-armed fourth, and yet, our so-called leaders are half pragmatist and half ideological fanatics.

Such an empire! How can it hold, half sane and half crazy?
Please do not give away the house democrats. please tow the line.

Instead of being a real leader the Speaker has chosen to be the obstructionist that the Tea Party loves.  For every day the so called Republican "Leadership" as in this manner, President Obama get closer to being reelected.  And that is okay for me!

The fact is that cuomo betrayed us. we didn't vote him in, we voted in a democrat. putting himself forth as a new york democrat, instead of the republican that he is, is so appalling i can't stomach anything he has to say.
expect anything from this guy. all of it worse than what we've already seen and heard from him.
i don't see why we can't recall his election based on his false party affiliation.

All those with income don't need to worry as their income will continue. All those without income, jobless, on unemployment please go stand in line at the nearest church, food bank or soup kitchen. The lines will be longer, there will be more homeless, there will be more jobless and there will be no unemployment, tax refund or government aid for anyone!

Let Congress do without their paychecks and see how quickly they can dance to keep the government running and their paychecks coming. Currently, the Republicans are doing a dance with the continuation of the Great Depression II.

Each republican senator or representative represents vested interests and want to shut down the federal agencies to avoid even collection or payments to small people. The shutdown is an extravaganza for the rich to sail in the sea while leaving the common man to struggle. U.S.A. the most admired country giving solace to millions of suppressed people is saddled with some unworthy politicians. To compare them with the noble founding fathers of this enlightened country brings tears in our eyes. We sincerely pray to god to help us and we repeat "Lead Kindly Light amidst the encircling gloom".

When the history of this era is written, I predict that President Obama will be criticized for letting this crisis happen at least as much - if not more - than the Republicans (especially their Tea Party members).

Why? Because President Obama is wise enough to understand the Macro Dynamic at play here yet he chose to do nothing about it.

And what is that Macro Dynamic? The conscious choice by certain elements of our society to Dumb Us Down... to orchestrate an Assault On Reason (as Al Gore called it is his masterful 2007 book by the same name... a book that received precious little attention at the time, because it wasn't about the environment)... and to use this assault to drive the American civic cultural conversation away from one based on Facts, Logic, and Emotional Honesty to one based on Lies, Illogic, and Ginned Up Emotions that are a product of those lies and illogic.

President Obama could have chosen to address the Intellectual Dishonesty that is running rampant throughout our society... like some insanity-producing disease manufactured in some secret laboratory of our enemies... but he didn't.

How am I sure he knows about this and consciously chose to ignore it? How do I know that, instead, he consciously chose to treat this disease as just an emotional phase people were going through that would pass? Well, I mailed President Obama a copy of Al Gore's book and got a personally signed letter from President Obama thanking me for the gift. (I know it was personally signed, because it came in a flat envelope protected from bending by cardboard even though it was just a one page letter.) And I enclosed with the book my own essay describing this disease-of-the-mind for the threat that it is.

But rather than be America's "Doctor-In-Chief", President Obama has chosen to let his (and our) opponents continue to get away with behavior that threatens the very well being of our society by sentencing it to a many years' long period of "10 year olds fighting in a school yard without bothering to learn the facts about what they're arguing about" existence.

This is why President Obama will be equally blamed. While others are sick, he chose not to provide the cure. While Reason was Assaulted, he chose not to come to its aide.

Shame on you, President Obama. I know it would be difficult to accuse the Tea Party of being out of touch with reality and in need of treatment. I know it would be difficult to accuse certain powerful interests in our country of orchestrating this Assault on Reason. But you wouldn't have to do it alone. You could call on Al Gore... and the many, many professionals who could speak about this attack... this illness... this dumbing down of our society from positions of authority. But you decided not to do so. And we are all suffering the consequences of your decision.

But there is still time to turn this situation around. There's still time to cure American of this disease... to stop the Assault on Reason. Here's a link to my essay, which gets into what the cure is as well as talking about the disease in greater detail. Maybe Al Gore will decide to start speaking about this again. He did an eloquent job during his 2007 book tour.

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/steven-g-brant/progressives-deserve-to-b_b...

Mind boggling to say the least. The Republicans want to replay the exact same play book they did in the '90's. It didn't work out well for them or the country then, and it certainly won't now. It seems that neither they, nor the American people that put them back in to power as a result of the temper tantrum of the 2010 elections have learned anything. I assume that the logical thing for the Republicans to do after this debacle will be the impeachment of President Obama for whatever reason they can come up with (Muslim, Kenyan, Communist, Socialist... Etc.).

Some people imagine that the Federal government is mostly about taking their hard earned money and giving it to illegal immigrants to have more babies.

We all need a reality check. The longer the shutdown takes, the more these people will learn about what the stuff the government does.

Hopefully it will not last long enough to kill jobs at the many private companies whose only business is with the government.

Can the democratic party for once grow a spine and hold their ground? What President Obama is doing is not compromise, it's just plain cowardice and I am sick and tired of this conviction-less/spineless President. I vote for a democrat and expect democratic policies instead we get more of the past 8 years. Same bailouts, same tax cuts for millionaires/billionaires, and another war.

For the love of God if you're a democrat BE A DEMOCRAT! Own up to your values, fight for your convictions! I want to see some brinkmanship, some guts, some foolishness, I want President Obama to walk toe to toe all the way down to the depths of hell. How is it possible that President Obama compromised on the tax cuts, my god, that is one of the central tenants of our party. I don't care if the republicans held everyone hostage! Never ever compromise on core principles, they are what define you. Who are you President Obama? A coward under the guise of a prudent man.

Let's see....reduce the goverment in half...reduce the pay of every elected official in half and leave medicaid and social security alone...we pay into these programs....we do not pay taxes to line their pockets in gold....how hard is that?

My suggestion to the Democrats is as follows. These tactics by the Republicans are similar to what we faced in Korea in an attempt to negotiate with the North Koreans. When one side doesnt care about the consequences then the reasonable party has to lay out your position and then declare thats it and stand behind what you said. You then have to publicize your position to the American Public and your position. You have to call out what your facing and then dig in your heels. Giving in or attempting to show reasonableness is akin to weakness, We also have to remember that our enemies worldwide are watching these events so that they understand what they might be able to do.
Negotiating only works when both parties are desirous of a solution .

I'm very happy with my Olympus EPL-2. I bring it with me much more often and to many more places than I ever lugged my DSLR. The photos look way better than those from my tiny pocket camera. In fact, the photos look fantastic, right out of the camera with little or no post-processing--especially with I use my Panasonic 20mm f/1.7 pancake (non-zoom) lens (no adapter needed).

I am now considering getting rid of my DSLR. I definitely plan to keep my tiny little (Canon) pocket camera though--it truly can go anywhere with me anytime and takes pretty good photos when the light is at least decent.

@13: I've taken some of my flights to do homework.. On a flight from ORD-ANC, I wrote a four page Art History paper, as we were gliding over the Alaskan mountain. Got an A on the assignment. Why judge somebody because they do something enjoyable? Everybody has their hobbies, and some of us like to travel. I flew to Sydney, Australia in May of 2010, and was there for only eight hours, before flying back to the US.. That was purely to earn almost 17,000 EQMs (elite qualifying miles).

Here's a scenario not getting any attention, but not at all unlikely. Who's to say once a shutdown takes effect, that it doesn't become our normal course of affairs?

In other words, what else could be less worry for a set that's not interested in policy, but obviously only politics?

Indeed, this situation is ripe for such an agreement. The facts are such that "non-essential" services are all that would be affected. But that's 1/4 of the largest single part of a pretty big economy. That, then the lesser levels of employment that have already been shown to be ripe for all types of games, will ultimately be privatized. Actually sold off to the lowest bidder(s), even though many of these same individuals running the respective companies will have long complained the services weren't at all needed!

I think we better come to grips that the US gov't is a resource. Because the belief it's the bane of our existence is only allowing this totally unproductive blame game to go on, right out into the open. With then backdoor meetings held to effectively parcel off a pretty big value, being where the charade we see is also staged.

Thanks!

At this critical juncture with so many seething problems requiring direct and/or exceptional funding support, the House Republicans are in zugzwang and would need to crawl out of the impasse.  With the upcoming election, time is not in their hands.  It is doubtful that they can get off unscathed.

why didn't the leftists (democrats) propose and pass a budget when it was due in October 2010.

Tea Party has nothing to do with this debacle. The time for compromise was 6 months ago.

Are you seriously telling me they couldnt find 15-20 billion of cuttable expenditures in Defence? Every penny there is golden?

Yeah, right.

I suppose there's a reason why we spend more than the next 47 countries _combined_ -- including Russia and China -- but it eludes me.

From 2003-2008 trillions of dollars in funding  for wars in Afghanistan and Iraq weren't even on the books, unaccounted for. These same republicans like Paul Ryan and Boehner supported this chicanery. When Obama added up the previous war spending and added it deficit he was blamed. Republican politicians could care less about you and your kids. Wake up America.

Article omitted that Ben Schlappig's original article on this appeared first on our site, TravelSort.com at http://travelsort.com/blog/free-flights-and-upgrades-10-tips-for-getting... where there are some additional tips covered.

Good review David!
You missed one MAJOR point, given your limited space allotment...

All Micro Four Thirds format cameras, including the EPL2 and GF2, are capable of using nearly every older 35mm and DSLR lens available, with the correct adaptor. That means you can use your older Nikon, Canon, Leica or other lens.

Because of the size of the sensor the focal length of all your "legacy lenses" (as they're called) will be doubled. (It's called a 2x crop) A 50mm becomes a 100mm equivalent, 35mm = 70mm and so on.

Most must be used in manual mode, but it's a great way to use some of the old camera gear that's been stashed in a drawer or in back of a closet for the past decade!

Also, Panasonic makes several M4/3 cameras with built-in electronic viewfinders and articulated LCD screens that are only a bit larger and more like a traditional DSLR form factor. The flagship DMC-GH2 is MUCH smaller and weighs considerably less than low and mid range DSLRs with, arguably, comparable still and superior Full-HD image quality.

In-depth reviews from the Digital Photography Review web site. http;//www.dpreview,com

Panasonic GF2: http://www.dpreview.com/reviews/PanasonicDMCGF2/
Panasonic GH2: http://www.dpreview.com/reviews/panasonicdmcgh2/
Olympus E-PL2: http://www.dpreview.com/reviews/olympusepl2/

Lock all three of them in the Capitol with no phone contact with the outside and no staff.  Terminate their salaries and freeze their bank accounts.  Fine them $1,000 the first day, $2000 the second day, $4,000 the third day, $8,000 the fourth day, etc. After a week, turn off the toilets.  Somehow we have to get their attention that compromise is essential if our country is to move forward.
